boardgame.name: tERRORbane
boardgame.description: Enjoy exploring a crazy and outlandish world, full of unique, quirky characters and homages to the history of videogaming, challenge the Developer with your creativity and be the Bane of Errors!
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 Gamescom Most Original Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Sammu-ramat
boardgame.description:
Sammu-ramat ruled the Assyrian Empire at a time of political uncertainty, which is one of the possible explanations for why Assyrians may have accepted her rule (as normally a woman as ruler would have been unthinkable). Her reign lasted between 811 BC – 808 BC. In this collaborative game you the players are Sammu-ramat, together with advisors surrounding the royal court and vassal states, you try to keep the Empire strong and protected against internal unrest, external threats, natural disasters and much more. All players win or lose together.

In this 1-5 player co-op board game, you will be one of the advisors surrounding the Assyrian royal court. Each Advisor has its own abilities and strengths. Players spend actions to play action cards and move from region to region along the paths printed on the board, trying to balance the needs of the regions (Military, Supplies, Health, and Religion). In battle with the enemy units are removed 1:1, i.e. combat is deterministic.

On each Empire card, there is a Scenario, with one or more win conditions. The specific setup of the Scenario is on the back of the Empire card. Multiple victory scenarios increase the game's replayability.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

boardgame.name: Steel Colosseum
boardgame.description:
Steel Colosseum is a competitive team combat arena game for 2-4 players, featuring a series of scraps between two teams of two customisable fighting robots.

Gameplay is card-driven. Each robot has its own unique Control Deck; each round, players simultaneously select a single Control Card for each robot, all of which are revealed simultaneously. Each card has a unique Speed rating, and the cards are resolved in order from highest to lowest. Once a robot has used a card, it is locked into their Command Chain and can't be used again until the robot powers down for a round, meaning that options become increasingly limited as the game continues.

When robots take damage, they shed Armour tokens, which are dropped into the arena as Scrap. If a robot takes damage to a facing with no armour remaining, it takes Serious Damage instead; enough serious damage, and the robot is deactivated, ending the Bout and scoring a point for the opposing team.

A game of Steel Colosseum is played to the best of three Bouts. Before each one, players have a chance to repair their robots and spend scrap on new Upgrade Systems. The available Upgrades are randomised each time you play.

boardgame.name: Alone Against Fear: La Cavalcata dei Templari Oscuri
Alone Against Fear: The Coming of the Dark Templars
boardgame.description:
The Coming of the Dark Templars is a short adventure for Alone Against Fear.

Will you manage to stop cursed crusaders who come back to life to avenge the times when they were judged, tortured, maimed and killed?

You move on a map (a poster-sized image is included in the download) trying to avoid the cursed crusaders -- who are blind, but have a special sense allowing them to hear your heartbeat.

Requires only the core Alone Against Fear book.

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Family Plot: Reapers Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
We lovingly refer to this pack as THE KILL DECK. It’s ALL REAPERS and when you have a deck filled with killers, it’s going to change the game up in a big way!

This pack of 20 ALL NEW cards will bring a darker element to the game, creating even more havok and chaos with new, creative elements that will make your game even more devious than usual. Even the Reaper Angel has some twists and this deck has the most powerful card we’ve ever created. Are you dark enough to put it in your deck?

Only you can decide if you’re brave enough for THE KILL DECK!

boardgame.name: Family Plot: Zombie Expansion Deck
boardgame.description:
You can’t have a graveyard without ZOMBIES! This pack of 20 ALL NEW cards brings the undead directly to your game, but bigger and better than ever before.

Like all of our new Expansion Packs, the Zombie Pack adds new, even more bizarre gameplay from the undead. We even got creative with the Family Members and, um, you may have to build them from different body parts. Yeah, it’s pretty crazy, but adds EVEN MORE fun to the game.

So, what are you waiting for? They’re still family. They just happen to be a little rotten on the inside and outside.

boardgame.name: Family Plot: Heroes Expansion Deck
boardgame.description:
The SUPER HERO Expansion Pack is a SUPER HERO-THEMED Expansion pack with all-new Hero family, Action, Modifier, Reaper, Angel and Family Tree cards! Don't miss out on all the HERO goodness!!!

This pack contains 20 ALL-NEW cards which can be folded directly into your core deck and also allow you to add another player to your game!

boardgame.name: Family Plot: NSFW Expansion Deck

Ever wish that Family Plot could get a bit more RISQUE for those adult dinner parties? Well, we’re with you . . . and your mother would not approve of this expansion pack. We know ours don’t.

ALL 20 NEW cards bring unique play elements to the game, including Family members that should never exist in polite company. You should be ashamed of yourself for even thinking about adding this pack. SHAME ON YOU.

boardgame.name: Family Plot: Boogey Family Booster Deck

The first ever family booster pack!

In honor of a lot of requests the Boogeyman Family Booster Pack was created and was only available through the Family Plot Kickstarter as an add on.

This One time deal was inspired by the very dysfunctional relationship with Endangered Orphans.

boardgame.name: Family Plot: Loser Family Booster Pack
boardgame.description: The last family in the core game was voted on by the Backers and they were awesome, but there were some runners up that deserved a little love too! So, by popular demand and a lot of whining, we decided to create the Backer-Created-Runner-Up Family Booster Pack! So, this is basically a pack of ten losers you can bring into your Family Plot Graveyard!

This pack contains 20 All-New cards which can be folded directly into your core deck and also allow you to add another player to your game!

boardgame.name: Family Plot: Endangered Orphans Booster Pack

Endangered Orphans/Family Plot Crossover Cards (3 Cards)

These cards were created in honor of our "beloved" orphan creators and depict the world's most majestic creature . . . well . . . destroying them. It's what we've all dreamed of, right? We also have to warn you, they are not for KIDS! So, grab them while you can!

This pack contains 20 ALL-NEW cards which can be folded directly into your core deck and also allow you to add another player to your game!

boardgame.name: Placement
boardgame.description:
This is a tennis simulation. The game is played between two players. They draw cards and the one with the highest number wins first serve and the player figure is put on space 45 or 44. Serve and return of service are resolved by drawing cards and following the drawn numbers. Then the players must draw a retrieve to reach the ball (move the playing figure) and to shoot the ball into the opponents court.

Scoring is the same as in actual tennis. The player winning six games first with a two-game margin, wins the set.

It is also possible to play Doubles.

boardgame.name: ANTIFA: Le Jeu
boardgame.description:
ANTIFA is a cooperative management simulation game where you play a local antifascist group.

Each month, the group will face several far-right actions. Players collectively allow activities to the far right actions they want to counteract, then each of them will take their turns assigning one of their militant tokens to a slot to increase the activity's efficiency until the group runs out of time or money. Once a token is placed it cannot be removed or moved. Discussion is highly recommended.

After the organisation phase, mishap cards are drawn for each action taken and may change the result. Weather also have a say in the matter by the roll of a die.

If the group managed to counter a far-right exaction (indicated by the efficiency level reached for that activity), their morale will increase, otherwise it will decrease.

For some activities there is also a risk of getting arrested and even put to trial.

The end of the game is quite open, the players may decide of their objectives (a certain level of morale after a specific number of months) or they can use one of the included scenarios (objectives to reach within a time limit).

boardgame.name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms ‚Äì Imperial Legion Faction Starter Set
boardgame.description:
Protect Tamriel and the third empire from your enemies with the staunch heroes of the imperial legion. Hadvar provides leadership and tactical expertise to the legion troops and is supported by the imperial mage, whose expertise with magic and weapons makes her deadly at range and up close. Finally, three imperial swordsmen provide a stalwart backbone for your force.

This set contains five 32mm scale high quality multi-part hard plastic miniatures with bases. Requires some assembly. Supplied unpainted. Scenic bases not included.

This set contains five 32mm scale high quality multi-part hard plastic miniatures with separate bases. Requires some assembly. Supplied unpainted. Scenic bases not included.

boardgame.name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms ‚Äì Bleak Falls Barrow Delve Starter Set

Explore the world of Elder Scrolls, as the Dhovakin faces the undead keepers of forgotten tombs and ruins. The Dragonborn delves into ancient Nord barrows and caves, equipped with her iconic weapons and armour. The Dragonborn is opposed by the deathless Draugr Warriors with Greatswords and creaking Skeleton Archers. These forces are led by one of the Dragonborn’s most fearsome enemies, the Draugr Overlord, who jealously guards the secrets of his resting place.

This set contains eight 32mm scale high-quality multi-part hard plastic miniatures with bases. Requires some assembly. Supplied unpainted. Scenic bases not included.

Dragonborn, Champion of Skyrim
Draugr Overlord, Bleak Falls Guardian
Draugr Greatsword Warriors

boardgame.name: Paladads and Dragons
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You are a holy knight of the Femme in the Moon. Ordinarily, you would be going out on epic quests to defeat evil, leaving passionate but doomed romances in your wake. But now, something has disrupted your adventures. Your last affair wasn’t with a beautiful buff butch princess, as you thought – she was actually a beautiful buff butch dragon taking human form. And now she’s off on her own adventure, and has left you with two rambunctious young wyrmlings to care for. Can you – and the dragon-kids – survive until she returns?

This is a tabletop roleplaying game for three or four players, plus an optional gamemaster (GM). The GM plays the non-player characters, describes scenes, narrates complications on failed rolls, and adjudicates the rules; if there is no GM, these tasks are shared by all the players. Two players take the roles of the wyrmlings, who seek to have fun and cause trouble for the paladad(s). One player (or two, if there are four players) takes the role of the beleaguered paladad(s), who must put their mismatched skills as a holy knight to work as a babysitter for the first time in their life. Along the way, some complication will arise that puts both the wyrmlings and the paladad(s) in danger.

Note: “Paladad” is a word I made up for the sake of the (not terribly clever) pun. The term is not meant to be gendered. Nothing’s stopping you from being a palamom or palathem instead.

boardgame.name: Roach Coach
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Cockroach Karl is headed to your part of the 'verse with his spacetruck filled with whatever he could scavenge. Are you hungry enough to eat what he's selling? Perhaps you'll try his daily special.

Roach Coach highlights an NPC and the things you might find on his traveling foodship in the Vast Grimm universe.

Includes:

Stats for Cockroach Karl
d20 table for What's On the Ship
d12 table for Side Effects of Consumption
d4 table for Karl's Daily Specials

boardgame.name: In Space... Food Eat You!
boardgame.description:

Created for the Spoiled Spoils Vast Grimm Game Jam. Just in case you ever needed a monster generator for carnivorous food products, here are 576 Monsters from the foul fridge to use with your favorite Vast Grimm, Mork Borg compatible, or OSR game!

boardgame.name: The Long Moonlight
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A tabletop role-playing game for at least two players!
The Long Moonlight is a rules-light tabletop game about being a creature of the moonlight, causing a ruckus. You could be anything from a ghost to a goblin to a scarecrow, as long as you know how to have fun.

boardgame.name: The Great Escape: Recon
boardgame.description:
The Great Escape Recon is a mini solitaire card game played in 3 stages and an expansion for The Great Escape.

Stage 1
At night you must escape the compound by making your way between huts avoiding any guards and searchlights. Reach the blind spot in the fence and, with a good pair of wire cutters, you should be able to make your escape.

Stage 2
Pursued by guards you must make your way across various terrain and either head straight for the border and safety or spend some time gathering vital information that will aid your fellow campmates should you be captured.

Stage 3
This stage combines the cards from The Great Escape with any knowledge of the surrounding area that you might have gained in Stage 2. Armed with this information the POWs from The Great Escape should now have a better chance of escaping.

Good Luck!

boardgame.name: Bumm Bumm Biber
boardgame.description: Starting player presses the button on top of the beaver's head and sounds of the forest start playing. Then players take turns rolling the die and based on the result you either move one of your squirrels forward from one treetop to another or move another player's squirrel backward. This continues until the the music stops and the beaver slams the pond with its tail and some of the trees fall. Squirrels from the fallen treetops are moved back to start and the trees are turned back up. Whoever is able to get both of their squirrels first all the way around the pond wins.

boardgame.name: Ghosts Love Candy Too
boardgame.description:
It's a little-known fact that ghosts love to eat candy. But they can only eat it one night a year...Halloween! On that night, the ghosts travel through the neighborhood looking for delicious candy. Using their best scare tactics, ghosts will haunt the costumed kiddos to steal their sweet sweet candy. But they have to be careful not to scare them away. Ghosts just want a candy delight, not to cause them a fright.

This new edition expands upon the original version with more kids (100 total!), a new "junk" set of treats that you do not want to collect (like toothbrushes, rocks, ketchup packets, pennies, etc.) and new ghosts.

Playing the game is easy. Select one of your ghost cards to bid for turn order. Then resolve by choosing a kid to haunt, taking their candy then using their unique ability. Treats score at the end of the game based on your ghosts specific preferences.

Note: Ghosts Love Candy Too is a revised and expanded new version of Ghosts Love Candy, released by Steve Jackson games in 2016.

boardgame.name: Peggle Blast
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Like other entries in the franchise, the player must clear each level of all orange pegs using a limited number of shots. Peggle Blast adds a world map with different fantasy characters such as a unicorn, an octopus, a squirrel, etc. Each character has their own unique powerup that can be obtained by hitting a green peg. Some levels have special objectives instead of clearing the orange pegs, like hitting phoenix eggs, or causing gems to fall off the screen. Special obstacles include fireballs, bombs, oily pegs, and more.

Extra lives and powerups can be purchased with microtransactions or by watching ads.

Disastrous chats and the new corruption prosecution complicate the player's life, but with a little skill you can get your sheep in the dry as part of the family.

(The expansion set is only playable with the board game KHG Corrupt Have Money)

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Darkness: Dark Eras 2 Storyteller's Screen
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

A sturdy three-panel screen featuring the beautiful collage of Dark Eras 2 art on the outer side, and on the inside there's a selection of charts and other info to make the Storyteller's job a little bit easier.

User summary:

Comes with an eight page leaflet with a timeline and additional minor rules.

boardgame.name: Kilim
boardgame.description:
The Sultan asked the weavers of the city to create their finest work for him, an exceptional Kilim! The Person who weaves the most beautiful one will be become the High Weaver of the Sultanate. An Honor and a promise of fortune that you cannot ignore. All you have to do is go to the market, buy the best carpets and assemble them to make a Kilim worthy of the Sultan!

In order to weave your Kilim, you will have to participate in the market auctions to get carpets. They have different patterns that can influence the final score. Since you are all in competition, you may want the same carpet, so you will have to offer the best deal possible without going broke.

Once you have acquired a carpet tile, you will place it in front of you to compose your work. After 3 days, the Kilim will be judged by the Sultan according to the way they have been designed. The one who has designed the best masterpiece will be named High Weaver of the Sultanate!

The game ends when all the tiles are bought and placed (after three rounds) and build in the Kilims of the players.

Victory Points are given for an rectangular shape of the carpet, for the use of patterns, for the biggest groups of patterns, for the player with most tiles of a pattern - and you loose points if you have open/visible "damaged" carpet parts.

boardgame.name: The Mustang Sallys
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

After years of failures, the American Olympic Dressage Team is going to the best training camp in the world to fight their way back to the top.

TV producer Howard Silva sees his chance to make good TV and puts the last of his credit debts into covering them with cameras.

But when the horses on the training farm seem to have a taste for human flesh, Howard ends up making very different TV from what he had intended...

---

A role-playing one-shot scenario with premade characters, heavy on intraparty conflicts, and originally written for the Swedish OOP role-playing game Splatter. Should be playable with any d6-like rule system.

boardgame.name: Holly Jolly: Krampus Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Insert the Krampus card into the deck of gifts mixed in with the presents and stockings. If you end the game with Krampus in your collection, lose two points.

Krampus has a stocking back, so players will not know if the stocking below the tree will have it if they choose that card. This is similar to the Coal card in the game. The biggest difference is that the Coal card is worth zero points, while Krampus will reduce your point total by two (no cards in the game are worth negative points so this adds that element of chance).

Included in the Tantrum House season 8 promo Kickstarter.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Holly Jolly: Gingerbread House Promo Card

boardgame.name: Holly Jolly: Gingerbread House Promo Card
Holly Jolly: Gingerbread House Tantrum House Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Insert the Gingerbread House card into the deck of gifts mixed in with the presents and stockings. If you end the game with the Gingerbread House in your collection, you can 5 points.

Since the card is a stocking, players will not know if the card they choose contains this added high value card. This is similar to the Robot stocking card and adds another reason you might want to go after those hidden stocking gifts instead of a known present card.

There are two versions of this card. One is a generic house and the other was available in the Tantrum House season 8 promo Kickstarter and has the logo on the house.

boardgame.name: Holly Jolly: Candy Canes Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
Shuffle the Candy Canes into your tinsel and lights deck. These count as "wild" cards, meaning they can be used as tinsel or lights when adding up your value totals.

There are six Candy Cane cards with the following value breakdown:

Two 5 value cards
Two 4 value cards
Two 3 value cards

Included in the Tantrum House season 8 promo Kickstarter.

boardgame.name: Jungle Dash
boardgame.description:
Competitors, welcome to Jungle Dash! You have been selected from among thousands of applicants to compete in this gruelling race through the Amazon Rainforest; however, only one can be crowned champion.

Jungle Dash is a race through the Amazon Rainforest for 2-6 players with push-your-luck and take-that mechanics.

On your turn, play Cards to overcome obstacles or hinder your opponents and roll the dice to move your Token. You may reroll failed dice to gain a bigger advantage, but you risk losing them all. The jungle terrain is slowly revealed as players progress, requiring that strategies adjust on the fly to overcome the new challenges.

The first player out of the jungle wins.

boardgame.name: Master of the Universe: The Board Game ‚Äì Plastic Castle Grayskull Pack
boardgame.description:
You can now own a Castle Grayskull replica and all of its accessories that pay homage to the original toyline. These not only look good, but are playable pieces and function in the game mode of the expansion.

The Castle Grayskull Pack includes:

1 Castle Grayskull
1 Castle Base
1 Hilltop
1 Training Dummy
1 Weapon Rack
1 Laser Gun
1 Banner
1 Ladder

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game ‚Äì Clash for Eternia

boardgame.name: Champions of Midgard: Metal coins
boardgame.description: Metal coins for Champions of Midgard

boardgame.name: Live Mission Game: The Heist ‚Äì Crime Does Pay
Live Mission Game: The Heist ‚Äì Verbrechen lohnt sich
boardgame.description:
Live Mission Game (LMG) is a new exciting game concept that simulates a mission in real time. As the mission leader, you are responsible for the smooth running of this operation. The game cleverly combines elements of both escape and detective games and is suitable for anyone who wants to live through a captivating mission.

In "The Heist" you'll act as a team that orchestrates field agents in carrying out a bank robbery.
The world is threatened by a massive cyber attack by the Zipacna cartel. Your mission is to break into the cartel's house bank to steal the financial resources planned for the cyber attack. Take your time to prepare the bank robbery and coordinate the field agents - keep in mind: the execution happens in real time! Save the world from the cyber attack!

This game is a one time experience but the game materials can be reused.

boardgame.name: Duty calls
boardgame.description:
Duty calls is a 28mm miniatures game designed to recreate modern and contemporary conflict in solo game or in cooperation mode. The game involves the use of infantry troops but it is also possible to implement air vehicles and supports for more substantial games. The aim of the game will be to free the streets and war zones from hostile objectives that will reveal themselves during the game in an unexpected way...

Game and war theaters
The game involves armed clashes and it is advisable to use a game table full of scenic elements to make the combat more exciting. The size of the table is at the discretion of the player and the mission you want to play but for a standard game it is advisable to start on a 3 '× 3' table.

Necessary material:
2d6, 1d20 one meter per inch, paper and pencil

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic ‚Äì Hanbrook Manor game supplement
boardgame.description:
Among the Town Elders of Shadowbrook, none are as influential and secretive as the Hanbrooks. Their grand estate outside of town is known throughout the area for its elegance and mystery.

This 15 card Game Supplement for the Dark Gothic Deck Building Game is themed for adventures at the stately Hanbrook Manor outside of the town of Shadowbrook and adds many new Locations in the Manor, as well as new Events, Gear, the Ally - Lucy Hanbrook, and more! This supplement utilizes the new Roaming mechanic first introduced in the Colonial Horror Expansion. Explore the mysteries of Hanbrook Manor and its surrounding grounds, but beware the Haunting Spectres that roam its regal halls!

- description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Son of Grogzilla (Issue 2 - Oct 2021)
boardgame.description: It looks like the mighty, three-headed, corruption spewing, skyscraper high, giant bipedal, terror lizard, has had a son.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: More Metal Than You'll Ever Live to Be!

boardgame.name: Travelers of the Multiverse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Journey to the far corners of the multiverse as one of the playable races in today’s Unearthed Arcana! This playtest document presents six races for Dungeons & Dragons: astral elf, autognome, giff, hadozee, plasmoid, and thri-kreen.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Unearthed Arcana: Travelers of the Multiverse

boardgame.name: The American Bible Challenge
boardgame.description:
What do you Noah about the Bible? Inspired by the award winning Game Show Network program, The American Bible Challenge Board Game is sure to bring plenty of fun to you and your friends! As in the TV show, teams must first come up with a Team Name which they write in the Bible podium area directly on the game board.

Players roll dice to advance around the board by answering trivia questions, spelling biblical words, organizing the books of the Bible and more linked to the color spot they land on. The player/team that answers one question in every color category first is the winner.

With over 1,000 unique questions and multiple levels of play, its a game you will love to play over and over again.

boardgame.name: The Hunted
boardgame.description:
publisher blub

The Hunted is a folk horror storytelling game for 3-5 players that blends together mechanics from Forged In The Dark, Powered By The Apocalypse, and Belonging Outside Belonging games to create a lean chimera of a game unlike anything you have ever played.

Players take on the role of a group of friends on an expedition who become cut off from civilization as they are hunted by an unknown entity. As the game continues the players will tell their own stories about the thing hunting them, building up a unique legend that feeds directly back into the narrative. The more stories you tell the more your characters succeed and the longer they survive - but with each story the Hunter grows stronger and becomes more of a threat.

boardgame.name: Conquest of Elysium 5
boardgame.description:
Turn based strategy game where you explore and conquer the world of Elysium. Random maps with 10 different planes, e.g. Celestial, Inferno, Hades, and the Elemental planes. Roguelike randomness and replayability. A living world, where the independent factions fight each other. Over 1500 monster types and a huge variety of special abilities. Over 500 different rituals to cast. Over 60 different paths of battle magic. Twenty-four different classes, many with their own special resources that they desire. 1 to 24 players, network or hotseat. Team play with AI or humans (simultaneous turns on network).

(From Features list on publisher's Web page)

The game manual is free to all. PDF download: http://www.illwinter.com/coe5/coe5manual.pdf

boardgame.name: Whalesong
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

Starwhales birthed the universe as we know it.

When a starwhale dies their body disintegrates, leaving behind a hot, dense heartstone that drops through the atmosphere and settles at the core of the gas planet that the whale called home. If left untended there, the heartstones of dead whales ignite the planet’s core and create new stars.

All stars are the products of dead starwhales.

Legend has it that if the heartstone of a dead starwhale is retrieved and returned to the upper atmosphere, it will summon the whale back from beyond death.

boardgame.name: Skulls of Sedlec: Zealots
boardgame.description:
Faith, like hope, springs eternal. Zealots served their mission well in life. Now they must be rewarded with proximity to other practitioners.

It will come as no surprise that Zealots interact with Priests. Each Zealot will score points for Priests that are either above or below them in the stack. Check each Zealot individually, choosing whether to score above or below, and then count the Priests in that direction. Devoting yourself to Zealots can be a huge boon to your score, as long as you can keep the faith.


Zealots is a 6-card expansion that shuffles into the game, adds the ability to play with a 4th player and is fully compatible with the solo expansion, Skulls of Sedlec: Monstrance, as well.

This expansion to Skulls of Sedlec adds a new type of skull: the Zealots. Zealots want to have many Priests above or below them.

Adding in the expansion is easy, just shuffle in the expansion cards to the base game and play.

boardgame.name: Skulls of Sedlec: Merchants
boardgame.description:
They say you can’t take it with you...but the Merchants have certainly tried.

These captains of industry profit from Peasants and make a tempting target for Criminals. Merchants can be a mixed bag, scoring points for adjacent Peasants but taking a penalty for adjacent Criminals. Unlike most skulls, this can cause an unwary player to actually lose points on poorly-placed Merchants. Keep your eyes on your money or you’ll end up buried in debt.


Merchants is a 6-card expansion that shuffles into the game, adds the ability to play with a 4th player and is fully compatible with the solo expansion, Skulls of Sedlec: Monstrance, as well.

This expansion to Skulls of Sedlec adds a new type of skull: the Merchants. Merchants want to be next to Peasants but avoid criminals.

Adding in the expansion is easy, just shuffle in the expansion cards to the base game and play.

boardgame.name: Skulls of Sedlec: Champions
boardgame.description:
Even in death, some still seek the roar of an approving crowd.

Champions benefit from gathering followers alongside them for one last hurrah. Much like the previously-seen Executioners, Champions score points for connected skulls of a certain type. Connected skulls are those either adjacent to the Champion or in an unbroken chain of the same type. Each Champion is associated with a different group from the basic game. Connect as many of that group’s skulls as you can to get the full favor of each Champion.


Champions is a 6-card expansion that shuffles into the game, adds the ability to play with a 4th player and is fully compatible with the solo expansion, Skulls of Sedlec: Monstrance, as well.

This expansion to Skulls of Sedlec adds a new type of skull: the Champions. Champions want to be next to groups of their supporters.

Adding in the expansion is easy, just shuffle in the expansion cards to the base game and play.

boardgame.name: Chicken and Chips
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

An existential road trip game about coming home from a night out and having a real craving for chicken and a kebab.

boardgame.name: Instructions For A Ritual
boardgame.description:
publisher blub

A ritual of summoning for 2 to 6 participants and 1 unseen guest.

boardgame.name: Legends of IdleOn
boardgame.description:
Form your own guild of characters, who all continue to play even when you’re gone! Whether you’ve got a few minutes to play or the whole day, Legends of Idleon provides the fun MMO experience you’re looking for, alone or with friends!

With 38 classes and 600+ unique skills, the possible synergies are endless! Maybe you’ll make a Barbarian Fisherman who catches sea monsters, for your Druid Alchemist to make into powerful potions, which boost the critical damage of your Hunter Assassin so he can defeat the World Boss, unlocking even more content!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Super Wild Card
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Device to stick into the cartridge slot and contains a 3.5" diskette drive and a cartridge slot. It makes it possible to create backup of your game on 3.5" disks, as well as loading your backedup data from disks.

boardgame.name: Crossroads Inn: The Innkeeper's Creed
boardgame.description:
Crossroads Inn. The Innkeepers' Creed is a fantasy engine-building strategy board game where you embody one of 4 competitive innkeepers, struggling to grow their taverns and attract customers from all over the world.

In the meantime, the medieval kingdom of Yorevale has monarchs die in mysterious circumstances and their illegitimate heirs competing with each other for influence and power.

YOU pursue fame, fortune and renown with your own inn - and perhaps, will have your eyes on the royal crown, too!

BUILD YOUR INN FROM SCRATCH!

Have you ever wondered what goes behind the scenes at a medieval inn in a fantasy world setting? Look no further!

Furnish, hire staff, and cook exquisite meals to satisfy guests from various social groups. Anticipate and block the actions of your rival Players, fellow innkeepers - in the end, there can only be one winner to rule them all!

HOW TO PLAY
‚≠ê Build Your Inn
‚≠ê Gain Reputation
‚≠ê Compete against other Innkeepers

There is plenty of room for good innkeepers in the Kingdom, but only one can rule them all! Compete for fame, fortune, and renown with your own inn - and perhaps, you will have your eyes on the royal crown, too!

WHAT'S NEW

We are currently running our Kickstarter campaign for Crossroads Inn: The Innkeepers' Creed - have a watch what our team has been brewing for some time!

‚úÖ Kickstarter:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/klabater/crossroads-inn...

‚úÖ WWW:
https://www.crossroadsinngame.com/

boardgame.name: Tinners' Trail: The Arsenic Expansion
boardgame.description: The Arsenic Expansion adds the extra resource of arsenic. Due to the danger of arsenic, it is mined at the cost of permanently losing work points but with the reward of a big cash payout.

boardgame.name: Tinners' Trail: The Emigration Expansion
boardgame.description: In The Emigration Expansion, you can send your workers overseas to gain ongoing benefits, such as extra income or free improvements.

boardgame.name: Wrestler
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The WRESTLER is a powerful combatant who locks their foes into devastating grapples and throws. This class uses a "Yacht Dice" mechanic to build momentum for the perfect maneuver.

boardgame.name: Tinners' Trail: Kickstarter Pack
boardgame.description: The Kickstarter Pack contains six dual-region survey cards to replace wild cards, and eight mine tiles (with alternate art, as a bonus) that provide either a refund of 1 work point or some money when won in auction.

boardgame.name: 1066: Tears to Many Mothers ‚Äì Ceorl Saxon promo card

Un ceorl était l'homme libre de rang le plus bas dans la société anglo-saxonne pré-normande, pas un paysan mals un home possédant des armes.

Ceorl Saxon: Saxon, Infantry, Militia

When Played: Ruse - Knock out 1 enemy unit in the wing of this card.

A ceorl was the lowest-ranking freeman in pre-Norman Anglo-Saxon society, not a peasant but a man with arms.

boardgame.name: Barrow of the Elf King
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

An exploratory location for fantasy tabletop adventure games. Suggested for a party of 3-4 level one adventurers.

boardgame.name: Deutschland in den 80ern
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Die Sonne stand bereits tief am Himmel und hüllte die Landschaft in ihren goldenen Schein. Die umliegenden Berge, die Bäume in den Wäldern, alles warf lange Schatten quer über die weite Landschaft. Die längsten Schatten schienen jedoch von den Kühltürmen der Königskron-Reaktoranlage auszugehen, auf deren glänzender Oberfläche sich das Licht brach. Es war die schönste Zeit unseres Lebens, voller Freiheit und voller Abenteuer. Und manchmal auch voller Gefahr aber ohne Gefahr wäre es ja auch kein richtiges Abenteuer.

Durch dieses Buch finden die Geschichten von Tales from the Loop ein neues Zuhause: Direkt vor unserer Haustür.
Verborgene Geheimnisse, mysteriöse Kreaturen, fremdartige Technik und eine Verschwörung von großer Tragweite warten nur darauf, rund um die experimentelle Reaktoranlage der Königskron GmbH im Taunus entdeckt zu werden!

Was dieses Buch bietet:

Deutschland in den 80ern: Eine komplette Beschreibung Deutschlands in den 80ern, die es nie gab. Die Jugend der Kinder in West- und Ostdeutschland wird dabei ebenso betrachtet wie das politische Zeitgeschehen jener brisanten Zeit am Ende des Kalten Krieges.
Der Taunus-Loop: Der deutsche Loop wird detailliert beschrieben. Von der Idylle der Orte, Wälder und Berge des Taunus bis zur Forschungsanlage der Königskron GmbH, mit zahlreichen Charakteren und Aufhängern für spannende Abenteuer ebenso wie eine komplette Mysterienlandschaft.
Kaiserspiel: Vier ausführliche Szenarien, die für sich alleine gespielt oder zu einer übergreifenden Kampagne verbunden werden können:


- Neue Deutsche Welle: Aggressionen greifen plötzlich überall um sich und machen selbst vor dem Umfeld der Kinder nicht halt doch was ist der Auslöser dafür?
- Im Bann der Bärchis: Das neue Maskottchen der Königskron GmbH, ein Teddy, erfreut sich direkt sehr großer Beliebtheit ... vielleicht sogar etwas zu großer Beliebtheit?
- Der Riss im Schleier: Als die Kinder beim Spielen auf einen mysteriösen Gegenstand stoßen, ahnen sie noch nicht, dass vor ihnen eine Geschichte von wahrlich unbekannter Dimension liegt.
- Wenn die Sirene schweigt: Irgendetwas stimmt nicht in der Reaktoranlage. Als der Schichtwechsel ausbleibt und die Erwachsenen von einer seltsamen Sorge erfasst werden, sind die Kinder doch die einzigen, die alle nötigen Puzzlesteine besitzen, um vielleicht gar den ganzen Taunus zu retten.

boardgame.name: Maniwalde
boardgame.description:
Simple strategy postcard game for two players.

Maniwalde was an elder of ancient Estonia. He died in the battle of St. Matthews day, alongside with Lembitu, defending his country from the Livonian order.

You're going to need six D6 dice (preferrably in two colours, 3 each), pen and a sheet of paper. Each player receives 3 dice of the same colour.

During their turn player 1 places one of their dice (while keeping the result) in one area and then may activate the special bonus of that area. After that it's other player's turn - and it continues until both players have placed all their dice on the gameboard. No area may have two dice from the same player or with the same result.

After a round ends players receive victory points for controlling the areas (in addition to the victory points received from the area bonuses, if any). Area is controlled by the owner of the die with the highest number. Those points are recorded on the paper and then new round starts.

Game ends after round three and all victory points are added together.

Full English language rules are available on the web site.

boardgame.name: Qloxx: AstroSnipe
boardgame.description:
In 2107, two planets are on the verge of an interstellar war. As the vanguard commander of AstroSnipe, your mission is to navigate through black holes and chaotic asteroids between the planets and snipe at the enemy's planet to make the first strike!

Qloxx: AstroSnipe is a 2-player abstract strategy game about connections and obstructions in the size of a matchbox! By laying down and replacing the 9 Pathway tiles on the board, you control your troops' laser to shoot down enemy fleets and establish safe encampments for back-ups. The side that first strikes the enemy Home Planet will claim victory!

Players place place or remove tiles on the centre board, or exchange one for another from hand.

The game ends and you win when the enemy Planet Tile (like the King in chess) is removed from the board. The game may also ends in a draw if both players are exchanging the same 3 tiles on the same spot for over a full cycle.

boardgame.name: Here to Slay: Berserkers and Necromancers Expansion
boardgame.description: An expansion to the cardgame 'Here to Slay' that introduces 2 new classes: berserkers and necromancers.

boardgame.name: Goetia: Nine Kings of Solomon ‚Äì Blessed D20 promo card
boardgame.description:
Spiel 2021 promotional card.

Card text: You sense a Demonic presence!

boardgame.name: September 2021
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to this month’s compilation of Studio M—’s Patreon! September was a grab-bag of a variety of ideas I wanted to write! New firearms options, new weird subclasses for the Daevic, Guru and Vizier, Stormbound’s autumnal expansion, and a suite of fungal veils!

boardgame.name: The Haunting of the Inn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When all you want is a drink at the inn, perhaps a warm bed for the night, of course it has been taken over by unspeakable horrors! If you're going to get an ale and a room, you'll have to brave the stench coming from the front door, and figure out what went wrong.

Originally written for Halloween 2018, this version is revised and expanded, now designed to work with C&C, OSRIC, or 5e.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Haunted Manor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: Haunted Manor is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: Haunted Manor is a modular set containing 176 modular tiles. Dozens of rooms are provided - typical manor house rooms like a parlour, dining room and bedrooms, alongside haunted and creepy rooms, plus generic empty ones. There are also numerous corridor tiles, in both stone and wooden floor variants, and a set of secret passages to place behind the facade! You can build an infinite number of haunted castles, creepy houses, strange abandoned homes, or dilapidated townhouses.

boardgame.name: Subzero
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The planet Icelis is a larger version of Europa: a world sheathed in thick ice with a liquid ocean teeming with life beneath. A scientific outpost established to study this wondrous environment instead finds something from the watery depths determined to kill everyone involved and destroy everything they’ve done…and the heroes might not be enough to stop it!

Subzero is a short adventure for Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe, and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG.)

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #11 - Oct 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magic items like the dune trap javelin, cheater's hat, banner of strategy, and alabaster icons of Bast!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like purifying mist, tranquil thoughts, irresistible onslaught, and hide from enemies!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the new college of mercenaries, the soldier of fortune, and the way of peace!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the sinister storm-cat ccoa, the nature-guardian madremonte, and the alluring xililcoatl serpent!

boardgame.name: Sanctum Secorum (Issue #44 - Oct 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Artifacts of the Ancients
Wersgor Blast Lance
Wersgor Cloning Chamber

Men & Magicians
Irritating Peasants
Wersgor

Mighty Deeds
Intercepting Shot
Manyshot
Richochet Shot
Take Aim
Thrumming Shot

NPCs
Brother “Poorlittle” Parvus
Hubert the Executioner
Lars the Executioner

boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Monstrous Miscellany #02: Giant Centaur, Krum the Smasher, Brain Moths, & Ulfartrolls
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Miscellany #02 is a collection of four new monsters designed for use with Labyrinth Lord, but readily useable with any Old School RPG:

Giant Centaur – A giant creature appropriate for Lost Worlds and Mysterious Islands.

Krum the Smasher – A monstrous godling who does nothing but smash the works of civilization leaving ruin and suffering in his wake.

Brain Moths – One eyed, one tentacled, flying purple brain eaters from another dimension

Ulfartrolls – Born of the union of lycanthropic witches and trolls, these berserker beasts surpass their ancestors in their wickedness and might!

Designed for use with Labyrinth Lord, easily used with any Old School RPG system!

boardgame.name: Murt's Miscalculation
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Twenty-five years ago, Murt, a humble storekeeper, was abducted one evening by Extraterrestrials. The Aliens did experiments on Murt and enhanced his intelligence by implanting nano-microchips in his brain. After his abduction, Murt developed a fascination for astronomy, interdimensional travel, theoretical physics, and mathematics. Murt’s fascination in these subjects caused his fellow villagers to question his sanity. “There will be a day to come…”, Murt told himself, “When my knowledge will save the entire village.”

This day finally came when the Village of Greenleaf was teleported to an interdimensional prison. The villagers were held captive, waiting for the Woman in Black to return to devour their souls. Murt understood the physics behind the Woman in Black’s interdimensional prison and knew that it was necessary to open a portal to the Woman in Black’s lair before she could regain her full strength. It was a race against the clock for Murt as he built the portal. After 5 days of endless work, Murt completed the portal, which allowed a band of adventures to enter the Woman in Black’s lair and defeat her, freeing the Village Greenleaf.

The long hours of work took a tool on Murt. As a result, Murt made a miscalculation in the return coordinates. Instead of teleporting Greenleaf to the present, the village was teleported 15,000 years to the past... A new and exciting world of adventure awaits YOUR PLAYERS in Murt’s Miscalculation.

Murt’s Miscalculation is a Level 3 adventure designed for a party of 6 to 10 characters. This adventure is part of the Greenleaf Adventures series and follows the events of The Cat and the Resurrection.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 14
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Nathingus - female human wizard
Rufftussle - male orc druid
Thringa Petalsoft - female elven paladin
Shoogar Thatchfloor - female halfling rogue

boardgame.name: Roguish Archetype: Fey Catcher
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“If there’s a creature on this plane to be avoided, it’s the fey. Even the so-called good ones play impossible games with mortal minds and take twisted pleasure in the chaos and confusion they cause. Believe me, after I chase what’s in your woods out and make sure it can’t lure your children away in the night, you’ll understand why my fee is so steep.”
- Zynus-Marthios, Fey Catcher

There are countless wild places scattered across the face of the continent. Ancient woodlands and groves where the trees reach so high toward the sky that they leave the world below them in a state of perpetual gloom and where thickets of briars and brambles grow so thickly between their trunks that the rabbits must hold their breath to scramble through them. It’s in the shadows of these great forests that the Fey Catchers do their work.

Fey Catchers are specialized rogues who have dedicated themselves to driving fey away from the mortal realms. Some are guardians looking to safeguard their own frontier villages and people from the unseely beings that would do them harm, while others work as bounty hunters who have found a lucrative niche serving the superstitious or unsavory. In either case, in order to effectively hunt their prey, Fey Catchers must subject themselves to a rare and esoteric ritual that changes the course of their lives forever.

This supplement includes:

The Fey Catcher rogue archetype.
A full table of Wyld Infusion changes that reflect your character's transformations.

boardgame.name: Magic Item Pack 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collection of 10 unique magical items for 5E including 3 Weapons, 2 Spell Focus, 5 Accessories, and 2 Mundane Magical items.

Mixed items designed with all character class types in mind.

Take your adventure further with our:

- Blessed Moonlight Lantern

- Blink Javelin

- Bone Wand of Flesh Magic

- Collar of Truthfulness

- Looking glass of the Investigator

- Majestic Cloak

- Necklace of Shared Affliction

- Quill of Arcane Writing

- Ring of Elemental Bending

- Wand of the Gardavale Witches

boardgame.name: Valley of the Four Temples
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A small village holds a secret and the answer lies within the Valley of the Four Temples! A village elder asks the party for some assistance in this sandbox scenario that was destined for KantCon 2020.

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition rules for the Filbar Campaign for four, third level adventurers and DM.

boardgame.name: Sub Zero
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forced underground by a second ice age, a struggling outpost of survivors encounter a new threat even more savage than nature.

boardgame.name: Warlock Patron: The Dragonbound
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some dragons utilize warlock servants as a means of collecting additional treasure for their hoards, while others may be bound to a dragon who imprinted upon them after hatching, a magical defense mechanism meant to defend wyrmlings from harm until they mature into the ferocious creatures of legend. Others who wield draconic power may use this pact as a means of forming an apprenticeship, granting their student a fraction of this magic until they prove themselves capable of using it independently.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a warlock character, the Dragonbound patron grants warlocks a portion of draconic power through intense elemental spells and martial prowess by suppressing others' magic around them. This PDF also includes two alternative pact boons, compatible with any warlock character.

boardgame.name: The Christmas Owl
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Christmas Owl is a supplement for ’TWAS – The Roleplaying Game Before Christmas. It introduces a new Player Character to the game, Solomon the Wise Old Owl, and a new Scene that can be used in your games of ’TWAS to introduce him into your adventures.

boardgame.name: The Nutcracker and the Mouse King
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Nutcracker and the Mouse King is a new adventure for ’TWAS – The Roleplaying Game Before Christmas.

One Christmas Eve, at the stroke of twelve, the Mouse King and his rodent army emerge from behind the skirting board to threaten the very life of the child who lies asleep in bed, waiting for Christmas morning. But the child has a defender – a Nutcracker, and his band of brave followers.

An epic battle ensues, until an invidious curse strikes the child down. Can the Nutcracker and his friends find a way to reverse the evil spell and defeat the marauding mice, or will the Mouse King triumph, damning them all?

Inspired by E. T. A. Hoff man’s timeless classic, which was also the inspiration for Tchaikovsky’s seasonal ballet, The Nutcracker and the Mouse King comes complete with three new Scenes that you can use in your games of 'TWAS, along with a new Player Character, and a new villain.

boardgame.name: Shards of the Jaguar: The Second Trial
boardgame.description:
A module pack for Shards of the Jaguar containing 5 modules:
- Cooperative game mode
- Hidden escape module
- Dynamic actions module
- Alternative character abilities
- Event module

boardgame.name: Fenugreek
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A myriad past, in that formless Long Ago, a cadre of death-worshipping elfs committed sins wondrous and terrible to master death. The eight most powerful of their ilk succeeded and so through means vampiric, alchemical or otherwise blasphemous descended below mortality to fester spider-like in the center of their web of ziggurats for all eternity. Left with an eternity to hone their hedonism, a great and terrible city festered or perhaps stagnated around them, springing up upon the salty shores of a preternaturally warm river, surrounded by frost-gripped mountains and endless, sweeping plains.

The journey to Azzakkastrin is a difficult one. There is great profit to be had from that blighted place, but great risk - whether it be the strange delights of hedonist immortals tempt travelers to remain, or the labyrinthe contracts and dark bargains proffered by the strange beings that lurk in that accursed place ensnare the foolish and the unwary, few return from the perfumed alleyways of those deathless elfs.

Fenugreek is #4 in a series of short hex- and dungeon-crawls for the PINKHACK system, but are easily adaptable to the OSR system of your choice. Each DOOMCRAWL is inspired by the iconic Special Herbs beat tracks by MF DOOM.

What's in this edition?

1d6 Rumors, Reasons for Visiting, and Factions
An 8-node pointcrawl across a city rife with terrible wonders and wonderful terrors
Encounters, treasure, puzzles, traps

boardgame.name: Saffron
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“... South of where the river meets the sea, south past where the red clay oozes blood-like underfoot, to Gomazzi, the Yellow Flats; rich in soil, dry in summer, clear skies and thick tangles of cedar groves and endless fields of flax and crocus, either more precious than gold or jewels…”

Saffron is #1 in a series of short hex- and dungeon-crawls for the PINKHACK system, but are easily adaptable to the OSR system of your choice. Each DOOMCRAWL is inspired by the iconic Special Herbs beat tracks by MF DOOM.

boardgame.name: Hope Not Lost
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hope Not Lost is a Solo Origin Adventure for a first level cleric. Hope Not Lost is designed for one gamemaster and one player. Though Hope Not Lost is designed for 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons it can easily be adapted to most RPG systems.

The adventure begins with the player's birth when they are left on the steps of a temple.

The priest of the church raises the player as their own child and to be a priest of the order. The first part of the adventure gives the player four encounters to develop and test their early morality and values.

At the end of the four encounters the player is ordained and is given their first character sheet. Depending on their choices they will gain light or darkness points to spend on customizing their skills before proceeding to the next portion of the adventure.

After the ordination the player is assigned a church in a remote village that hasn't had a priest in over three years. Upon arriving to the remote village the player will have to repair relations with the village and its people.

The adventure climaxes with the discovery of a dark secret and a dungeon the player must conquer to restore order to the village.

What Is Included
Hope Not Lost Includes the following with the digital download package:

42 Page PDF of the main adventure module
Maps available in both PDF and JPEG formats
A Narration Package that includes both Audio files of most of the read alouds and Videos for many of them, too.
Pregenerated Character sheets for the Life, Light, and War Domains
A Master Player Handout PDF that has many graphical handouts you can use either digitally or to print physically and give to your player for most of the encounters.
A Temple Worksheet which can be treated as a mini game for the player to work on and upgrade the Temple of Narbonne
A short Gamemaster guide PDF to help the GM understand the flow of the adventure.
A PDF of a Sermon and Prayer Journal designed to help the player actually roleplay delivering a service at their temple
SEPERATE AND OPTIONAL - A set of physical cards have been made for this adventure too and are available as a seperate product
boardgame.rpgpublisher: A Hole In The Ground Terrain & Games

boardgame.name: Greater Villains (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every hero needs an antihero, every defender of the light must have darkness to keep at bay and every pure‚Äêhearted paladin needs a vile, shadow‚Äêcloaked assassin to cut down. Villains presents seven such malign foes to bedevil your heroes. Each villain benefits from an extensive write‚Äêup including notes on their background, personality, mannerisms and distinguishing marks as well as a fully detailed stat block and plot hooks making it easy to insert the villain into almost any campaign.

This instalment presents six villains—unique mummies, vampires, liches, vampires, werewolves and demons—of terrifying power to bedevil your characters.

boardgame.name: Greater Villains (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every hero needs an antihero, every defender of the light must have darkness to keep at bay and every pure‚Äêhearted paladin needs a vile, shadow‚Äêcloaked assassin to cut down. Villains presents seven such malign foes to bedevil your heroes. Each villain benefits from an extensive write‚Äêup including notes on their background, personality, mannerisms and distinguishing marks as well as a fully detailed stat block and plot hooks making it easy to insert the villain into almost any campaign.

This instalment presents six villains—unique mummies, vampires, liches, vampires, werewolves and demons—of terrifying power to bedevil your characters.

boardgame.name: Greater Villains (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every hero needs an antihero, every defender of the light must have darkness to keep at bay and every pure‚Äêhearted paladin needs a vile, shadow‚Äêcloaked assassin to cut down. Villains presents seven such malign foes to bedevil your heroes. Each villain benefits from an extensive write‚Äêup including notes on their background, personality, mannerisms and distinguishing marks as well as a fully detailed stat block and plot hooks making it easy to insert the villain into almost any campaign.

This instalment presents six villains—unique mummies, vampires, liches, vampires, werewolves and demons—of terrifying power to bedevil your characters.

boardgame.name: Rise of the Lagomorphs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Something has caused the local rabbit population to explode. Unusual birth rates lead to strange mutations. As time goes by the rabbits become gigantic, intelligent, and full of bloodthirsty ambitions! Can your characters stop the Rise of the Lagomorphs?

boardgame.name: Carousing Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What better than carousing to spend your hard earned gold coins ? Not only it will give the PCs xp but can lead to interesting and unexpected emergent stories.

Unfortunately, drinking and eating this much can lead to difficult situations the following days. This supplement will help you determine what happens/happened after/during these outrageous parties.

This supplement contains:

50 situations that can happen during/after a (few) night(s) of carousing.
d6 subtables to give them more granularity.

boardgame.name: Orcs (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sundara is a vast world filled with a huge number of creatures. In Species of Sundara we explore some of the more common creatures, their unique cultures, and the differing variations they display.

The series began with elves, and then it talked about dwarves. But now is the time of the orc!

Stronger, faster, and more durable than many other species, there are hundreds of myths and legends about orcs. From whether their genesis is truly tied up with the elves and their arcane manipulations, to feats of terrifying bravery, and deeds of horrifying brutality, the tapestry of orcs is woven from many different threads. From the myths of the shadowy Nemlocks in their dark caverns beneath the world, to the tales of great packs of Menanka who prowl the dense forests of the wild. From sailors stories of the Barrada in their seagoing tides, to the colossal Ferruna on the plains, these orcs all come with their own cultures, customs, and unique adaptations to make them truly stand out.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: Orcs (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sundara is a vast world filled with a huge number of creatures. In Species of Sundara we explore some of the more common creatures, their unique cultures, and the differing variations they display.

The series began with elves, and then it talked about dwarves. But now is the time of the orc!

Stronger, faster, and more durable than many other species, there are hundreds of myths and legends about orcs. From whether their genesis is truly tied up with the elves and their arcane manipulations, to feats of terrifying bravery, and deeds of horrifying brutality, the tapestry of orcs is woven from many different threads. From the myths of the shadowy Nemlocks in their dark caverns beneath the world, to the tales of great packs of Menanka who prowl the dense forests of the wild. From sailors stories of the Barrada in their seagoing tides, to the colossal Ferruna on the plains, these orcs all come with their own cultures, customs, and unique adaptations to make them truly stand out.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: S5E: Superheroic Roleplaying for 5th Edition
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the Kickstarter page:

Dark times calls for superheroes. Injustice, terrorism, and violent crime are on the rise. Our cities are battlegrounds, our suburbs are no longer safe. Who will step up and be counted? Who will bring hope to a world on the edge of despair?

We thought it would be you.

Gear up and assemble your team. You're in for one hell of a fight.

S5E: Superheroic Roleplaying for 5th Edition is a 300+ page guide loaded with exciting new content that brings all the action from comics and movies to your 5E game. We've got all you need to create, equip, and play the superhero of your dreams. Whether you're a lone vigilante, a cosmic powerhouse, or the mother-of-all street fighters S5E has you covered. We're offering more content, more choices, more backgrounds. Climb onboard.

World ain't getting no better while you'll wait.

boardgame.name: Places of Mystery II - Alluring Alcoves
boardgame.description:
from the back cover:

DANGER HERE?... IMPOSSIBLE!

...The central altar Is a gleaming pillar of jet black stone. Columns rise to the ceiling above. joining the arch in a delicate tracery. A sense of ambush seems to cling to the architecture and decorations...

...A voluptuous siren gazes from the tapestry. She has glistening, palled lips and heavy lidded eyes, and her scarlet dress Is molded to her sensuous. curving form...

...The crypt below exudes strangeness. a glimpse of a macabre fairyland. Fountains play a merry tune. The air is fragrant from the carpet of while and pink petals strewn on the floor. The coffins are carved with women In wedding gowns...

What does your party do?

boardgame.name: Your First Job
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hit the ground running with Your First Job, an introductory adventure for the upcoming Astral Tides: The Roleplaying Game!

Based off of the space-pirate-opera series of the same name, Astral Tides sees players come together as a crew of starsailors, voyaging through the Han'Arai Galaxy to see what adventure and mystery they can uncover.

This introduction includes a brief adventure for 1st level starsailors, the basic rules to get you started, and six pregenerated characters to print and play with immediately! The adventure is written to teach you the game as you play it, and a summary of the basic rules are included at the back of the book for your convenience.

By the end of this adventure, characters are ready to ascend to 2nd level and continue their journies through the galaxy. Look for The Bones of Rocuron, a 2nd to 5th level adventure that picks up where Your First Job left off. Also look for Astral Tides: The Roleplaying Game Core Rules to be released alongside The Bones of Rocuron, allowing you to continue your adventures beyond 5th level!

User summary:

This item is distributed as two PDF files:

34-page quick start scenario
six 2-page pre-generated characters

boardgame.name: Bazaar of Ubar
boardgame.description:
The Bazaars of Ubar is a fantastical engine-building game that takes players to the mythical marketplaces of Ubar - the Atlantis of the Sands! Draft trade tiles from a common area, paying for them with time, in a marketplace where the costs shift like the sands from game to game. Make clever use of tradewinds to activate your drafted tiles again and again. Manage the space on your ship to carry only the most precious cargo as you make your way to floating bazaars to sell your goods. Watch for fluctuating values in the markets to make sure your goods bring in the most gold and ensure your victory as the shrewdest trader in The Bazaars of Ubar!

During setup, Trade tiles are laid out in a grid in the center of the table. On a player's turn, they take a trade tile from the center area and, paying a time cost for it. The time cost is spent by moving their ship along the path toward the next bazaar.

After taking a trade tile, a player adds it to their tableau adjacent to previously taken tiles - activating the newly taken tile and previously taken tiles in their tableau according to the direction of the trade winds on their tile. Trade tiles allow players to earn new goods from the supply or trade goods they already have for more desirable goods.

When a player's ship reaches a bazaar, they may sell any number of the goods they have in their ship (to marketplaces with fluctuating values that vary from game to game). When all players have reached a bazaar, the trade tiles in the center are cleared and a new grid of trade tiles created.

When all players have reached the third bazaar, the game ends and the player with the most gold from selling their goods wins!

boardgame.name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Alicorn Promo Card
Le Rovine Perdute di Arnak: carta promo Corno di Unicorno
Les Ruines Perdues de Narak: Carte Promo Alicorne
