boardgame.name: Sacrifice
boardgame.description:
In Sacrifice, 5 players take turns placing cubes in a grid, hoping to score many points. Players may only place a cube in the left-most empty space of a row. Some spaces require a player to remove other cubes they have placed.

Once every space on the board is full, the game ends and players are awarded points based upon the spaces they occupy, with a bonus in each row for whomever has the most and second-most cubes.

The player with the most points wins.

The game also includes a variant for 4 people to play with a non-player character taking the fifth color.

boardgame.name: Droids: The Unsung Heroes of Sci-Fi
boardgame.description:
The goal of any game of Droids it to tell a compelling, engaging and fun sci-fi story from the perspective of the lowliest of characters. Stories from the view of the tools, the side kicks, the extras, the scenery, the plot devices, the slaves, the oppressed, the overlooked and sometimes the unwanted.

What story you tell is up to you and your group, but I suggest you stick to stories of heroism and hope. Stories where your Droids rise up from their humble beginnings and become something so much more than their creators ever thought they could be.

These stories could range from helping to overthrow a galactic empire to rising up and starting a new era of Droid freedom and independence.
boardgame.rpg: Droids: The Unsung Heroes of Sci-Fi

boardgame.name: Mistsmall: Mistfall in 18 Cards
boardgame.description:
Mistsmall is posted with permission from NSKN Games. Mistsmall is only for personal print and play game for free download. You can find the files for Mistsmall in the files section.

Mistsmall is a fan-made game that reduces Mistfall to 18 cards and a few tokens. Mistmall uses the game's original art, helping capture the feeling of playing big Mistfall. Play as Crow, using your feats, gear and resolve to traverse dangerous regions and defeat The Abomination.

Players will move from location to location, playing cards from their hand and using their gear to manage the current encounter, deal damage to and block damage from enemies, and manipulate the board state.

The game ends in victory when players reach the final location and defeat the special encounter. The game is lost when players must take damage but are unable to. Players take damage by Burying cards from their hand, deck and discard pile.

boardgame.name: The Lost Tomb of Ar√πn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arùn the Godking was a king in ages past. His kingdom spread wide and his reign lasted for 90 years.

A wizard before he became king, he had his life prolonged via magical means. The people of his kingdom worshiped him as god, and many say his power was matched only by that of lesser deities and above.

As many things in the multiverse though, he also fell. No one knows how or why, but one day he died at the age of 130. The next of kin could not be as influential, strategic and powerful, so his kingdom fell in ruins. Cataclysmic events caused floods and rains of acid, and now, 1000 years after the fall, only desert remains where the kingdom once was.

Recent sandstorms have uncovered an ancient tomb temple. The resting place of the godking. Rumors say that deep inside, guarded by a creature placed there by the gods, is Arùn's most prized possession in life. An ancient artifact that could change the multiverse. Recovering it is of utmost importance and ambition for many factions in the world, and it is up to the adventuring party to brave the dangers of the tomb and the challenges of the guardian if they want to be the ones to claim it.

The Lost Tomb of Arun is the sixth adventure released by Adventure Bundles. We are content creators for 5e and release monthly adventures and encounters for it.

With this adventure you get:

Adventure PDF
jpgs of the dungeon map in many formats for online play
jpg of a hexcrawl map
Sandstorm mechanics in the form of hexcrawl
Printable PDF with many versions of the map(grid, gridless, printer friendly)
4 homebrew items as printable item cards
Praised homebrew mechanics

boardgame.name: Delusions of Grandeur
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is a kobold clan living in an abandoned dwarven mine. They call themselves, Iga Shuvne, which loosely translates in common to The Big Ones in the Mines. The name is new. The kobold chieftain changed it after the discovery of a wand, as he thought it better describes what the clan now resembles.

It was about a month ago, when a scouting group of kobolds exited the mines to patrol the surrounding desert and cliff side. There, on the ground, near a patch of dried bushes, they found a wand which allowed them to change their size. Although they have made themselves smaller while testing the wand, the actual interest was on the property that allowed them to enlarge themselves. They brought the item back to their chieftain, and since then, he boasts with confidence, pride and even declares dangerous ideas about attacking the nearby villages of men.

Stopping the king and recovering the wand is now a task of highest priority.

Delusions of Grandeur is the fifth adventure released by Adventure Bundles. We are content creators for 5e and release monthly adventures and encounters for it.

With this adventure you get:

Adventure PDF
jpgs of 2 dungeon maps in many formats for online play
printable PDF with many versions of the maps(grid, gridless, printer friendly)
6 homebrew items as printable item cards
illustrated kobold traps
1 printable player handout

boardgame.name: On the Crimson Trail
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strathenberg stronghold is one of the most isolated structures in the known world. Situated in the very north, where in the winter the snow covers the land. There are rarely any problems here, and these are mostly wildlife or weather related. The local guards who serve baron Strathenberg have usually no problem dealing with such issues.

In the past month or so, though, locals have been disappearing. Either during a hunting trip, on a firewood haul, or even while taking a walk in the forest. There has been talk about strange lights in the forest behind the stronghold. Eerie, flickering lights that peer through the fog.

No local guards are willing to investigate. They are simply not trained to deal with the supernatural, and the baron knows this.

On the Crimson Trail is the fourth adventure released by Adventure Bundles. We are content creators for 5e and release monthly adventures and encounters for it.

With this adventure you get:

Adventure PDF
jpgs of 5 battle maps in many formats for online play
1 player handout
4 items as printable item cards

boardgame.name: Deadly Waters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Halenshire is a small town built in and around natural springs. Since about 1 month there has been a mysterious disease spreading among the population. Some people only experience fatigue and vomiting, while some other unlucky ones even die. The people are afraid, mainly because it appears to be spreading randomly. There have been cases of people from same households getting infected, and others where only 1 family member got it and died. In other words, it is a mystery. Is it a curse? A sign from the gods? A sinister act? No one knows thus far. Some other stories say that the dead had been drained of blood, others that the local cleric is sinister. To make matters worse, some of the dead bodies seem to disappear during the night.

Suspects exist plenty, especially in a town as Halenshire which sees a steady influx of visitors. The local Cleric is new in town and has been acting strange and overzealous, there is talk about the tavern being in the middle of things, and the traveling circus which arrived at the city almost at the same time as the first infection appeared.

The party will have to investigate as many possible suspects to get to the truth, which will be more surprising than anyone in the city has thought.

Deadly Waters is the third adventure released by Adventure Bundles. We are content creators for 5e and release monthly adventures and encounters for it.

With this adventure you get:

Adventure PDF
jpgs of 3 battle maps in many formats for online play
1 town map
1 diagram showing the flow of adventure and the many different paths the PCs can get to the end
printable PDF with many versions of the maps(grid, gridless, printer friendly)
4 items as printable item cards

boardgame.name: Demiplane of the Young Lich
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hubris. Blasphemous experiments. Fall from magic.

Experience the realm of Kyzog'Zunal, an ancient wizard who went too far in trying to understand the sources of magic.

The party travels in the demiplane of Kyzog'Zunal, uncovers his blasphemus research, meets his imprisoned subjects, explore his maze of gems and eventually fights him to loot his treasure and end his research.

Demiplane of the Young Lich is the second adventure released by Adventure Bundles. We are content creators for 5e and release monthly adventures and encounters for it.

With this adventure you get:

Adventure PDF
jpgs of the dungeon map in many formats for online play
printable PDF with many versions of the map(grid, gridless, printer friendly)
3 items as printable item cards

boardgame.name: Down the Rat Hole
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

How would you like to shrink down and venture inside a rat burrow?

This mystical adventure lets the party explore the unique wonders and dangers of a rat burrow built beneath a tavern. A patron of the establishment tasks the party to recover her lost ring. One of those pesky rats snatched it last night and dragged it into its burrow. Desperately to get her possession back she approaches the party for help. Will they accept and brave the dangers of this tiny dungeon?

The party must face different perils in this alien world. In there, brute strength might not always be the best choice. The adventure favors clever and strategic play and rewards the "first observe then act" type of approach, ideal for a party of low levels with limited magic tools at their disposal.

After passing the boss of the dungeon the party must face one last danger. They have to cross the busy tavern floor in their tiny forms to reach the quest giver again who promised to turn them back to their old selves once the ring is returned.

Down the Rat Hole is the first adventure released by Adventure Bundles. We are content creators for 5e and release monthly adventures and encounters for it.

With this adventure you get:

Adventure PDF
jpgs of the dungeon map in many formats for online play
printable PDF with many versions of the map(grid, gridless, printer friendly)
2 items as printable item cards

boardgame.name: Forge of the Fire Giants
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep inside the volcano known as Mount Calamity lives a tribe of fire giants, the Smoldering Cave Clan. No record exists of their coming here, but some say they were shaped by the mountain and lava many years ago. Some other stories say that the giant god Setag created them at the beginning of time when the world was shaped. No matter which story of their origin is true, though, one thing the scholars agree upon. There is a forge deep within the volcano that is shaped by lava rock as part of the mountain.

The party will venture inside, reach the heart of the volcano, and after fighting the mythical fire giant smith they can use the forge to craft an item for themselves. But that's not all! After the PCs use the forge, the cave will start to collapse because the volcano is about to erupt. The PCs will have to make haste if they don't want to be buried alive in a fiery volcano!

Forge of the Fire Giants is the fourth adventure released by Adventure Bundles. We are content creators for 5e and release monthly adventures and encounters for it. Check our links on the back page of every adventure!

With this adventure you get:

Adventure PDF
jpgs of the dungeon map in many formats for online play
printable PDF with many versions of the maps(grid, gridless, printer friendly)
4 items as printable item cards
2 homebrew creatures

boardgame.name: Armor Talents 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even more martial talents for making the most out of your armor, including Armored Evasion, Armored Momentum, and even using alchemical components to improve the power of your armor!

For Pathfinder 1st edition and the Spheres of Might system.

boardgame.name: Kessler's Guide to Dungeons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kessler’s Guide to Dungeons is the ultimate guide to dungeon crawls, demons, devils, madness, and more! Embrace the blessing of the spider goddess to play as a drider, or become a being of pure fiendish power with the playable demons or devils. Beyond just a tiefling, these allow you to sacrifice magic item slots in exchange for powerful diabolic and demonic powers, like devil’s sight, invisibility, shapechanging, the ability to hurl fire or acid, stunning screeches, and plane shifting. Or play as one of the lovable myconids, with a host of different fungal spore powers from spore-based telepathy to hallucinogenic debuffs to paralyzing pacification spores.

Confront the horrors of the cosmos or just the horrors of a life of constant violence and danger with the new system for stress and madness, which can be used for the standard Lovecraftian campaign premise, but can also be added into any campaign to give it a more grounded and gritty tone, one in which the psychological toll of adventuring matters as much as the physical.

Confront the zealous, all-consuming malice of the devils in their struggle for cosmological domination, or the alien horror of the demons as they spread out to infect and consume everything, with detailed examinations on how these fiends operate, what they want, and how they think and act differently from each other.

And of course, no guide to dungeons would be complete without a guide to designing them, and Kessler’s has an extensive guide to dungeon design, focusing on believable design that fits into the world, variety so that longer dungeon crawls remain interesting, and non-linear design that gives the dungeon a real sense of exploration.

Plus advice for running evil campaigns that aren’t a train wreck, new dark elf and demonic stats, and more, in Kessler’s Guide to Dungeons!

boardgame.name: Quailfolk Ancestry
boardgame.description: From publisher blurb:

boardgame.name: Sidereal Confluence: Bifurcation
Siderische Konfluenz: Die Spaltung
boardgame.description:
Sidereal Confluence: Bifurcation includes variations on each of the nine original species, providing entirely new mechanisms, new strategies, and new avenues for negotiation! These variants represent different aspects or factions within their societies — from Deep Unity to the Zeth-Charity Syndicate. The alternate versions may be freely intermixed with the originals, but both versions of a species may not be used in the same game.

This expansion features iconography and graphic design that match the Remastered Edition of Sidereal Confluence; however, since so few components in the game are randomized, you should be able to use it with the original edition without too much difficulty.

Hassle in the Quagmire: An introductory Swords & wizardry adventure of wizard Floofy Familiars Trying to save their swamp!

boardgame.name: Êà¶ÂõΩ„Éñ„É™„ÉÉ„Ç∏ (Sengoku Bridge)
boardgame.description:
In Êà¶ÂõΩ„Éñ„É™„ÉÉ„Ç∏ (Sengoku Bridge), a trick-taking game, the players discard cards from an initial hand in order to draft special powers or conditions that will define the hand. (Cards discarded are shuffled and redistributed so that players have the same number of cards in hand.)

Some powers allow a player to choose the trump suit, for instance. Another power gives a player the Joker, the highest card in the game, which they can play regardless of if they could have followed suit. Yet another power allows that player to never need to follow suit. There is another power that if a player can reveal a hand of cards that all share a suit, that suit immediately becomes trump.

Tricks are not worth any points, but collecting certain ranks is. The player with the most points at the end of a hand is the winner.

boardgame.name: Unearthed Spoils (Volume I - Embracing the Void)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unearthed Spoils Digital Magazine – Volume I contains the following:
MAGIC ITEMS – There is little that the Void’s grasp can’t influence, these seven Magic Items included.
ARCHETYPES – Those who have embraced the Void have shaped the power gained there into formidable weapons; both steel and eldritch alike. Explore new archetypes for the Ranger, Rogue, and Warlock.
MAGICAL SPELLS – The Void is a realm of flowing energies, open to many spell wielders. Ten new spells are sure to give your campaigns a touch of the unknown.
GM VARIANT RULE: INSANITY – The Void has driven many brave adventurers to the brink of insanity. Now, Game Masters have new rules to utilize.
MONSTERS – A host of monsters that can be found in the Void. Eight new beasties are ready to assault adventurers that stray too far from safety.
SHORT ADVENTURE – Birth of The Dark Tree is a short adventure that is intended to be run as a one-shot or can be dropped into a long-running campaign.

boardgame.name: Unearthed Spoils (Volume II - Into the Fey Lands)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unearthed Spoils Digital Magazine – Volume II contains the following:
MAGIC ITEMS – Magic is teeming in the Fey Lands, and has infused these sixteen new Magic Items.
ANCESTRIES – Centaurs roam the Fey Lands. These nomadic beings are always on the move, in search of excitement to satisfy their curiosity and satiate their appetites.
ARCHETYPES – Those who call the Fey Lands home are bestowed enchanting gifts. Explore new archetypes for the Fighter and Sorcerer.
MAGICAL SPELLS – The Fey Lands are host to many foreign magics. Ten new spells are sure to give your campaigns a bit of added excitement.
GM VARIANT RULE: UNSTABLE MAGIC – Magic works differently in fey-inspired lands. These rules will add in a touch of unpredictability to your campaign.
ENCOUNTER MAPS – 3 battlemaps with 3 additional variants (6 maps total) have been included to explore the Fey Lands.

boardgame.name: The Grave Warden
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing the Grave Warden - a new 5th edition compatible class!
Interested in livening up your D&D 5e games? How do you feel about the lore surrounding life and death? Take a look at the Grave Master, an arcane caster interested in manipulating necromantic magic!

The Grave Warden is in intelligence-based caster obsessed with the dark arts. They specialize in spells and incantations that allow them to harness the very life-force that flows through all creatures. Where a life-force is not present, they are able to instill a mimicry of foul life, rising these dead creatures from their once peaceful earthen resting places to serve a greater purpose. Flavor of undeath oozes from this class: unholy appendages, undead servants and necromancy specialization. To obtain these gifts, the grave wardens forgo study in the other arcane disciplines (drastically reducing their spell list in favor of becoming more like the undead they keep in their company). The Grave Warden is a complete D&D 5e class with four fully detailed archetypes, called requiems, that will give players unique options when creating and playing their characters. The archetypes are: Requiem of the Ash, Requiem of the Frigid, Requiem of the Haunt, and Requiem of the Torpor.

The included PDF contains instructions on creating a Grave Warden, how they might fit into your DM’s world, and detailed descriptions for all their abilities.

boardgame.name: The Vicar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing the Vicar - a new 5th edition compatible class!
Interested in livening up your D&D 5e games? Feel that there isn't a class completely dedicated to keeping the party alive? Take a look at the Vicar, a pact-magic divine caster focused on taking care of their brethren!

The Vicar is a pious pact magic divine casting class. Typically, high-ranking members of their clergy, vicars strive to fulfill a greater purpose. In their search, they are guided by their deity to pledge themselves into the service of a celestial being and are granted divine powers as a reward for this devotion. However, patrons don't accept a pledge from everyone who seeks to enter into their service, rather only those deemed capable of carrying out their duties are brought under their tutelage. The Vicar is a complete D&D 5e class with three fully detailed archetypes, called pledges of foundation, which will give players unique options when creating and playing their characters. The archetypes are: Pledge of the Curator, Pledge of the Predicant, and Pledge of the Watcher.

The included PDF contains instructions on creating a Vicar, how they might fit into your DM’s world, and detailed descriptions for all their abilities.

boardgame.name: The Deathseer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing the Deathseer - a new 5th edition compatible class!
Interested in livening up your D&D 5e games? How do you feel about the lore surrounding life and death? Take a look at the Deathseer, a martial one-third carster interested in maintaining the balance between life and death!

The Deathseer is a one-third caster, focused maintaining the balance between life and death by signing a "Reaper's Contract" - an agreement they strike with a deity to act on their behalf. They may choose to bind themselves into servitude for any number of reasons, be it to protect the weak from perishing before their time, possess the ability to make difficult decisions without being clouded by moral ambiguity, or because they simply revel in battle and conflict. Regardless of the reason, their deity's expectations are unwavering, and for their obedience deathseers are granted a seemingly limitless source of power to carry out their will. The Deathseer is a complete 5e class with three fully detailed archetypes, called reapers, which will give players unique options when creating and playing their characters. The archetypes are: Reaper of Mettle, Reaper of Omen, and Reaper of Ruin.

The included PDF contains instructions on creating a Deathseer, how they might fit into your DM’s world, and detailed descriptions for all their abilities.

boardgame.name: Êà¶ÂõΩ„Éñ„É™„ÉÉ„Ç∏„ÄåÁæ§ÈõÑÂâ≤Êã†„Äç (Sengoku Bridge: Gun'y≈´ Kakkyo)
boardgame.description: The expansion Êà¶ÂõΩ„Éñ„É™„ÉÉ„Ç∏„ÄåÁæ§ÈõÑÂâ≤Êã†„Äç (Sengoku Bridge: Gun'y≈´ Kakkyo) adds more special player powers to the base game.

boardgame.name: The Fox in the Forest
boardgame.description: App version of the board game The Fox in the Forest.

boardgame.name: Savannah Park
boardgame.description: App version of the board game Savannah Park.

boardgame.name: Trick or Treat: The Aftermath
boardgame.description:
Trick or Treat: The Aftermath is a game where you and your friends split up all the candy you collected on Halloween! Take turns dividing up your Halloween haul and claim the piles that will score you the most points! As you collect your favorite candies, you'll also gain bonuses and tricky abilities to help you get the tastiest mix at the end of the night!

This roll-and-write game uses an "I Split, You Choose" mechanic and takes around 15 minutes for 1-3 players to enjoy.

To setup, give everyone a scoresheet and a writing utensil. Then, pick one of the colors to be your "secret color" and write it on the back of the scoresheet. You will score this color twice during scoring. Now you are ready to roll!

Each round, one player will roll all six dice and divide them into a number of piles equal to the number of players. Then, starting with the next player, everyone will take a pile of dice, leaving the player who split them up to take the last pile. Everyone then writes the die values from their piles in their matching color column and then starts a new round.

The game ends when one player has completely filled two columns. All values are then added up, bonuses are counted, and the person with the most points wins!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

boardgame.name: At The Height of Battle: The Battle of Fukuda Bay, October 1565
boardgame.description:
The Battle of Fukuda Bay is a scenario for At The Height of Battle in which a Japanese fleet engages a small Portuguese squadron over a matter of honour, in the first naval engagement between Japanese and European warships.

–Description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nations & Cannons: Starter Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The year is 1775. The British have amassed in Boston, and the 2nd Continental Congress has just formed a provisional government. Without help, the Patriots will surely fall to the British forces. Join the fight for liberty in this Revolutionary campaign setting for 5e.

Nations & Cannons has everything you need to play historical adventures set in the American Revolution. Well researched and vigorously play tested, these rules include new backgrounds, feats, and character options for living and fighting as an unconventional hero in the 18th century.

boardgame.name: Richelieu
boardgame.description:
A French-language crossword card game published in Quebec.

Each player starts with 10 cards (or 7 if six people play), each with a letter on it. On your turn you play cards forming a word onto the table; after the first turn the word must fit with the others in a crossword fashion similar to Scrabble. Instead of playing a word, you may discard a card and draw from the deck or discard pile.

When someone plays all the cards from their hand, the other players add up the points remaining in their hand (5 points per consonant, 10 per vowel, 15 for the wild Richelieu card), and add it to their total. When someone reaches an agreed-on total (e.g. 100 points), the player with the fewest points wins.

boardgame.name: Black Panthers: A Panzer Grenadier Book
boardgame.description:
Panzer Grenadier: Black Panthers tells the story of segregated African-American units that fought in World War II.

Black Panthers is a special expansion for Panzer Grenadier: Elsenborn Ridge. It has 24 new die-cut playing pieces for the Black Panthers under their distinctive insignia, and two dozen scenarios based on the epic battles of the 761st and other African-American units.

Most of the scenarios in the Black Panthers set feature the two battalions that served on the Western front alongside white divisions. The 758th Tank Battalion remained a light tank outfit, attached to the African-American 92nd Infantry Division in Italy. The 92nd did not have a very good war, thanks in large part to its spectacularly incompetent commander, Edward “Sic ’em Ned” Almond. They often fought against die-hard Italian Fascists, who of course aren’t included in Elsenborn Ridge (and have yet to appear at all in the Panzer Grenadier series), and in terrain very different from the wooded hills of the Ardennes. But the 761st and 784th provided plenty of action.

The nature of those battles is that of grinding, close-quarters combat, emphasizing combined arms cooperation.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Elsenborn Ridge: Tactical Combat During the Battle of the Bulge ‚Äì A Panzer Grenadier Game

listing.notes: New.

boardgame.name: Book of Lost Lore
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

New options to expand your old-school roleplaying game!

This book contains new playable races, new character classes, new magic, alternate combat and treasure systems, and much more for GMs and players alike. You'll find classes including the musical bard, merry jester, studious savant, and villainous blackguard. scores of new spells and magic items, and much more.

Written for the First Edition of the world's most popular RPG, this book will also be useful to anyone running a game using old-school rules.

boardgame.name: Book of Lost Beasts
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nearly 200 new monsters for your old-school campaign!

From the massive prehistoric ambelodon to the terrifying plague zombie, within these pages you'll find a bevy of new monsters to use in your campaign. There are angels, bladegrass, undead dragons, rakshasa nobles, and much more! Creatures found in dungeons, wilderness, the prehistoric past, the sea, and even alien planes of existance are within.

Written for the First Edition of the world's most popular RPG, this book will also be useful to anyone running a game using old-school rules.

boardgame.name: Skulls of Sedlec: Crown of Bones
boardgame.description:
Alone, you enter the ossuary. Your head bows instinctively before the Crown of Bones, a formidable relic of enduring construction. But that’s not all this hall holds. Altars, sconces, crucifixes: some of the most symbolic and resonant icons of bone occupy the room. You must find a way to replicate them all in order to consider yourself a true master.

Crown of Bones builds on the solo play mode found in Monstrance, introducing 6 new Features to construct as well as 6 new scoring patterns to incorporate. Players will choose 1 of each randomly at setup to guide their gameplay. Crown of Bones is playable without Monstrance but the scoring condition side of the cards will require the skulls from the expansions. If you think you’ve mastered Skulls of Sedlec, step forward and claim your Crown.


Skulls of Sedlec: Crown of Bones is a 6-card expansion for Skulls of Sedlec, allowing for solo play.

This solo expansion celebrates these works of art by allowing you to create six unique features alongside a standard, pyramid-shaped stack of skulls. Each play session adds a condition that will make this undertaking a challenge for even the sharpest skull-stacker!

boardgame.name: Diary in the Dark: The Wailing Lady
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

PRECOCIOUS KIDS ON BIKES

Cravenswood is not a normal town. It has all the usual trappings of one, quaint local shops, a town fair every year, with townsfolk possesed with pride of being different from the big city folk. Most people would call these kinds of towns quiet or a place where nothing happens. That’s not the case here. Things happen, strange things, but nobody wants to talk about them. Questions are met with ‘hush now, you’ll scare the out-of-towners’ or disapproving scowls at the fact that this small slice of Americana isn’t as it first appears. That’s why I’m writing this now my own investigation, a regular report on the weird things happening here. My Diary of the Dark.

This story pack contains background and setting for the tale of 'The Wailing Lady' which can be played with a number of different character groups. The pack contains full background and additional ideas for running the story as well as specific rules for use with the SHIVER RPG.

boardgame.name: „Ç¶„É´„Éà„É™„ÉÜ„É≥ (Ultriten)
boardgame.description:
In „Ç¶„É´„Éà„É™„ÉÜ„É≥ (Ultriten), the players take part in a trick-taking game that features nature, buildings, monsters, and heroes.

Each player has a scoring area for each suit, and it starts as a pristine forest. As things happen to each suit, cards may become "fallen", and their points will change. For instance, a pristine forest is worth more points than one you've erected a building on. However, a monster that has been defeated by a hero will be worth more points.

The trick-taking phase is a must-follow round with no trump suit. The winner takes all the cards from the trick and places them in their scoring areas.

After three rounds, the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: The Crossing
La Travers√©e
boardgame.description:
Your long and perilous journey home is almost over. Only one last obstacle stands between you and your destination: that wobbly suspension bridge, unstable and treacherous, especially when winter is approaching and the wind is blowing in icy, unpredictable gusts. One false step, one shift, and you could lose part of your precious cargo. Hunger and cold will also sap your strength. And the night which is inevitably approaching will be your doom if it catches up with you before you have found refuge on dry land, on the other side of the bridge. Despite all these dangers, you set off and begin the crossing.

Each turn, players will program a few actions from their board (with action tokens) and resolve them. This will often involve moving forward along the bridge, revealing and resolving bridge cards and potentially weather cards. The game ends when the bridge is crossed or the night has caught up to the character or too much cargo has been lost along the way.

boardgame.name: Little Factory: Suburbs
boardgame.description:
Mini-extension of 4 cards to add to the game.

Rules:
Stockyard: Lets you exchange 1 Sheep with a 1 Cow, or vice versa.
Recycling Center : Lets you spend 1 Barrel to gain 1 Wood and 1 VP.
Supermaket: Lets you spend 1 or more Resource cards (of any level) to gain a single Level III resource card worth less than or equal to the value of the cards you spent.
Hardware Store: Lets you spend 1 Clay and 1 Wall to gain 3 VP.

boardgame.name: Tabriz
boardgame.description:
Weave and sell luxurious carpets in the bustling Persian market city of Tabriz. Fill commissions for the commoners and before long the merchants and royals will take notice as well. Earn the most prestige from completed commissions to win the game and become known as the undisputed master of your craft.

On your turn, you move one of 3 assistant meeples through the Grand Bazaar and take the action where it lands. Actions include buying, trading, and rolling dice for wool, camel hair, silk, plant dye, and carmine dye. Each assistant has limited range, but with careful planning you can set up a quick and efficient series of actions to net you all the materials you need for your commissions before another player completes theirs.

At the end of each turn, if you have the necessary materials, you may complete 1 commission you have in hand.

Resources are limited and the market fluctuates every round. Watch for opportunities to grab more for less, and be careful to avoid moments when the resource you need is out of stock everywhere. Gain skill to attract better commissions, move your assistants further in each round, claim and complete multiple commissions at once, and earn bonus prestige. Optionally, play with the Advanced Workshop Mode so every weaver has their own unique ability taken at the start of the game and at the end of every round.

When any player completes 9 or more commissions, or gains the maximum of 14 skill, the current round is finished and the player with the most prestige wins!

Includes a robust solo mode with multiple AI opponents.

boardgame.description: Webbed is the story of a happy little spider on an adventure to save her boyfriend from a big mean bowerbird.

boardgame.description:
Unpacking is a zen puzzle game about the familiar experience of pulling possessions out of boxes and fitting them into a new home.


A zen puzzle game about unpacking a life

Unpacking is a game about the familiar experience of pulling possessions out of boxes and fitting them into a new home. Part block-fitting puzzle, part home decoration, you are invited to create a satisfying living space while learning clues about the life you’re unpacking. Over the course of eight house moves, you are given a chance to experience a sense of intimacy with a character you never see and a story you’re never told.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Wars of the Republic: Ancient Roman Wargaming 343‚Äì50 BC
boardgame.description:
From the First Samnite War and the eventual conquest of the Italian Peninsula, to the defeat by Hannibal at Lake Trasimene, and final victory over the Gauls at Alesia, Wars of the Republic is a miniature wargame that allows you to campaign with the legions or stand firm against Roman expansion and fight throughout the ancient Mediterranean.
This book contains all the rules required to fight battles during this period, including multiple army lists to reflect the changing nature of the Roman military and the varied opponents they faced, be it Gaul, Italian, Carthaginian, Iberian, or Greek.

–Description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tabriz: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
You are a skilled carpet weaver in the bustling Persian market city of Tabriz and your goal is to become the best known master of your craft. You accomplish this through savvy acquisitions from the market row and tactical completion of commoner, merchant, and royal commissions.

The heart of the Tabriz card game is the commission grid, an irregularly shaped series of resource requirement cards that form commissions in columns and rows. Complete a commission by dedicating the necessary resources for an entire column or row, removing those requirements from the grid and changing all connections commissions at the same time.

Commissions are defined by their length:


3 cards is a common commission
4 cards is a merchant commission
5 cards is a royal commission


Complete commissions with more cards for better rewards, including more coins and higher prestige. Merchant and royal commissions also earn you permanent abilities that contribute to your game engine.

On your turn, you take two actions. Actions include buying a Material card from the market row, trading a Material card you have for one in the market row, purging the market row, or taking 5 coins from the supply. At the end of each turn, if you have the necessary materials, you may complete 1 commission on the grid. You claim these Commission cards, changing the grid for future turns.

Earn the most prestige by the time the Commission deck runs out and you become the master weaver of Tabriz!

boardgame.name: Hack n Slash
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Hack n Slash is a light OSR RPG ruleset that fits your pocket.

Deadly and super light rules for old style dungeon crawling.
You have almost* all you need in one A4 page: rules on the front and player sheet on the back.


Polyhedral dice set, pencil and eraser are not included

boardgame.name: aether
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

aether is a systemless setting location, created for the Pocket Places Jam.

This setting includes a city on the back of an airship, a trapped cosmic entity of pure darkness, a stone that defies gravity, a young inventor and alchemist, and a list of special items that have been locked in an arcane vault.

boardgame.name: The Portable Colonial Wargame
boardgame.description:
The rules have been designed to be used with a gridded tabletop made up of squares or hexes.
This book has fourteen chapters, two sets of rules, two exemplar battle reports, two appendices, a list of sources of inspiration, and over one hundred and ten illustrations.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lore Master's Manual
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The waters of knowledge flow slow and black beneath the mountains of civilization. These subliminal rivers well up into the earth of society through cracks of doubt and questions. They quench the parched throats of seekers of discernment who would lower their lips to their gelid surface.

Student of lore, you shall thirst no more. You have dipped your hand into a streaming whorl of wisdom. You have cracked the spine of this tome searching for answers to questions both asked and unasked. We, the humble authors, masters of obscure scholarship, hope that you find within these dusty folios what you seek, but we can offer no guarantee. For the river of knowledge pushes past all resistance with a will of its own, creating its own destiny, like time and tide.

From the Kickstarter:


New class: the thief, go from a knife-wielding cutthroat to the shadowy power that rules this town
New class: the shaman, fueled by the Immortals of Beasts, channeling their wild power
New stock: the Troll Changeling; they're part troll, part human and all trouble
New conflicts: Banish, Abjure, Bind and Battle
New settlements like Borderland Fortress, Shire and Walled Town
Lots and lots of gear in a comprehensive list
Rules for making base camps—good for tackling those megadungeons.
Economic rules so you can crash the economy of your town
Travel rules
Simple guidance on town adventures
More spells and invocations
More monsters!
Wild new rules for spiritual quests

boardgame.name: Stop the Train!: The Silver Flame Train Counter
boardgame.description: The Silver Flame Train Counter

boardgame.name: Dungeoneer's Handbook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Adventurer is a dirty word. You’re a scoundrel, a villain, a wastrel, a vagabond, a criminal, a sword-for-hire, a cutthroat.

Respectable people belong to guilds or the church or are born into nobility. Or barring all that, they’re salt of the earth and till the land for the rest of us.

Your problem is that you’re none of that. You’re a third child or worse. You can’t get into a guild—too many apprentices already. You’re sure as hell not nobility—even if you were, your older brothers and sisters have soaked up the inheritance. And if you’re cursed with visions from the Immortals, the temples won’t take you in. You question their authority and subvert their power, so you are outcast like the rest of us.

And if you ever entertained romantic notions of homesteading,
think again. You’d end up little more than a slave to a wealthy noble. So there’s naught for you but to make your own way. There’s a certain freedom to it, but it’s a hard life. Cash flows out of your hands as easily as the blood from your wounds.

But at least it’s your life.

And if you’re lucky, smart and stubborn, you might come out on top. There’s a lot of lost loot out there for the finding. And salvage law is mercifully generous. You find it, it’s yours to spend, sell or keep.

From the kickstarter:


Revised character creation which includes tighter Nature question results
Revised leveling costs
10 levels for all classes (up from 5), including revised benefits for levels 1-5
New class: Theurge, a mad seer possessed by the immortals
New arcane spell memorization system, The Memory Palace
New divine magic system, The Immortal Burden
New invocations and spells with revised, clarified format

boardgame.name: Cartographer's Compendium
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ruins, lost cities, sunken temples, forgotten shrines and fetid caves are hidden throughout the world of Torchbearer. They are the last vestiges of peoples and civilizations swallowed by a vast and harrowing dark. Terrible dangers lurk in their midst: vicious traps, cunning monsters and hoary curses.

We who have nothing but our wits and courage to sustain us have no choice but to plumb their depths for the treasures left behind. The misfortune of our predecessors must preserve us as we struggle to survive this cruel world.

Some of us crave adventure and the thrill of the unknown. Others among us hate and fear this life, but must persevere nonetheless. Some of us lust for bloody contests of sword and claw, while others seek to prove their minds and skills acute against the myriad dangers before them. Some seek untold wealth to pull themselves from poverty and despair. A precious, precious few dedicate themselves to driving back the dark to aid those folk, more fortunate than we, who have homes where they can shelter together behind stout walls against the howling wilderness. It is only when we are tested that our true nature is revealed.

Within these pages lie the secrets of six lost places to test, terrify and delight adventurers.

boardgame.name: Scavenger's Supplement
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Scratching through the depths of their dimmest prolegomena, our lore masters have struck esoteric gold for you, dear reader. They have unearthed arcana that breathes life into six novel classes of being: the redoubtable bounder, the esoteric dreamwalker, the clever guide, the dangerous sorcerer, the weird stoneteller and the foolish noble scion. Not to be outdone by the likes of thieves and shamans, each new class joins our ranks as a new iconic character, as well: Ivy, Haave, Lorne, Aile, Tollan and Glytta raise their mugs with us now, making our official numbers 15. Which is an occult and auspicious number because five is the number of Wheel and three fives is the most sacred configuration.

And of course, grasping hold of just a single root is impossible. One must trace the entire chthonic system to its furthest extent. Thus these new classes emerge from the penumbra shedding a new system of magical expertise, new traits, weapons, denizens and even a new settlement in which you may rest your weary head.

Too magnificent to describe with terse phrases, these annals must be beheld with one’s very own eyes. So tarry with us here no longer, sifting through this muck we fancy as an introduction. Read on, dear eyes, read on to your black heart’s content. We shall hear tell of your sordid exploits soon, we doubt not.

boardgame.name: Scholar's Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Torchbearer is a roleplaying game of desperate adventure. In the game, players take on the role of fortune-seeking adventurers. To earn their fortune, they must explore forlorn ruins, brave terrible monsters and retrieve forgotten treasures.

From the kickstarter:


New easy-to-process difficulty factors format throughout
Revised skill format—much easier to parse
Revised and clarified reward system
Iconic monsters all in a revised, cleaner format
New loot tables—with more treasure!
New camp and town events (they're so good!)
New demo adventure: Revised and updated Dread Crypt of Skogenby!

boardgame.name: Catastrophe
boardgame.description:
In Catastrophe, you and your friends prepare for an unforeseen disaster, securing resources and surviving the impacts to emerge alive together!

Players may be hit with any one of Catastrophe’s nine possible disasters. Can you survive an earthquake? What about a volcano or cyber attack? Maybe a radiological disaster will test your mettle. Strategize your way through seven potential emergency impacts with a wild card each round that will catch everyone by surprise. Will you hoard your resources or share with your neighbors?

The player who survives with the most vitality tokens will win, but be careful — if anyone perishes, the game is lost for all!

boardgame.name: Liter√≥wka
boardgame.description:
Literówka is a real-time game for 2-6 people in which players need to simultaneously write 6 words starting with letters shown on 6 rolled dices (consonants and/or vowels) according to drawn category. The first player to write down those words flips a 17-second timer. That player is now the fastest player, and every other player now has 17 seconds to write down their words.

When the timer runs out, players compare their lists of words and remove any words found by multiple players. Points are then awarded for remaining words: 1 point for each original word which moves a player's pawn on a score track. The track has 38 places and the first player who reaches the end of a scoring track is the winner.

boardgame.name: Autismo Autism Challenge
boardgame.description:
A board game that looks at emotions, life skills and moral dilemmas in a fun way.

Each player chooses a character and then they each take turns going around the board and answering either questions on certain cards or collecting baggage and skills cards each relating to emotions, life skills, social rules and moral dilemmas. A player can win the game if they have the most skills cards and the least baggage cards in a certain timespan.

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Avel: Adventurer's Toolkit
Kroniki zamku Avel: Niezbƒôdnik poszukiwaczy przyg√≥d
boardgame.description:
The monsters circling around Avel Castle, and especially the approaching Beast, are a real danger for the people of this land. It’s not surprising then that everyone wants to help with the battle. Craftsmen are crafting items, dwarves are building siege machines, and herbalists
invent new recipes and boil potions. Even the wildness people will join the battle if you can prove your bravery by defeating monsters. Use their help and together protect Avel Castle!

Chronicles of Avel: Adventurer's Toolkit is an expansion that brings even more variety to your games! The characters created by you will get new, useful items and will have a chance to discover unknown corners of the land and all the possibilities they present. The expansion also introduces new monsters — if you manage to defeat them, you might be able to get the favor of animal companions who will gladly give you their helpful paws… or wings, if you need them.

boardgame.name: Temple of the Last Titan
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Temple of the Last Titan is a Fifth Edition adventure intended for three to five characters of 9th to 11th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 10. Characters who complete this adventure should earn enough experience to reach one-quarter of the way to level 11. A hidden temple deep in the Muhar desert has been holding a powerful prisoner for centuries. A secret order has seized control of the temple and is now working to free the prisoner for their purposes. This adventure takes place in the Freelands campaign setting but is designed to be used as a stand-alone or fit into an existing campaign that has a desert temple with only a few modifications.

Background
Over five hundred years ago the Titans, storm giants who wielded immense power, banded together under the banner of their influential leader, Draegan Stormrider. He led them on a brutal campaign across Astaria that lasted over fifty years until his capture. The Holy Ignis Empire scattered his forces to the winds. They converted an abandoned subterranean temple into a secret prison to hold the powerful giant and other prisoners of war. A holy order, the Knights of the Eastern Sun, watched over the prisoners and to protect the world from the danger they represented.

Centuries passed and the prison faded from memory as the Empire focused its attention on the Great War with Z’hing Tao, the elven kingdom. The Knights of the Eastern Sun kept their vows, defending the prison and watching over their charges. Only Stormrider remained, and the Knight’s numbers dwindled to almost nothing, the prison falling into disrepair. They were unprepared for the attack by the Order of the Revered Rose, the underground cultist followers of the fire god Trasklyn, looking to take back their ancient temple. They wish to unleash Stormrider on the Holy Ignis Empire once more to aid them in their rebellion against the Empire. After slaughtering the remaining Knights, the Order forces have taken control of the prison and are working on removing the seals to Stormrider’s cell.

boardgame.name: Entrance to the Valley of Kings (part 2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The follow-up hex to Part 1 of the Populated Hex Monthly Release, this book contains a dungeon located under the ruins of the ancient burial complex. Once used by the Crocodile Kings to prepare their dead for interment, the complex is now controlled by a necromancer and his small army of undead minions as he seeks to lean the secrets of the complex. Also contains four new necromantic spells to add to your OSE or similar game.
